block.p: While an exhibition of Polish circus posters, ''Cyrk,'' is on display at the Consulate General of Poland from Friday through Dec. 12, there will be opportunities to sample Polish food and drink. The tastings will be held from noon to 2 P.M. on Saturday, and again on Dec. 9 and 12.

While an exhibition of Polish circus posters, ''Cyrk,'' is on display at the Consulate General of Poland from Friday through Dec. 12, there will be opportunities to sample Polish food and drink. The tastings will be held from noon to 2 P.M. on Saturday, and again on Dec. 9 and 12.

There will also be tastings on Monday from 7 to 9 P.M., when a panel discussion, ''Polish Influence on the Arts,'' will be held. There is no admission charge. The consulate is at 233 Madison Avenue (37th Street).

Hungry art lovers may also note that in conjunction with an exhibition of royal Persian paintings at the Brooklyn Museum of Art, there will be a lecture about the food of Iran, accompanied by a buffet on Dec. 10 at 6 P.M. The lecture will be given by Najmieh Batmanglij, a cookbook author. Tickets: $55 for museum members, $65 for nonmembers. Information: (718) 638-5000, ext. 326.

A beer tasting led by Michael Jackson, the beer expert, will be held on Monday starting at 7 P.M. at the Brooklyn Brewery, 79 North 11th Street, Williamsburg. Beers in a dozen styles will be paired with food from Cucina and Mike & Tony's restaurants in Park Slope. Tickets, $30 in advance and $40 at the door, will raise money for a scholarship given by the American Institute of Wine and Food. To reserve: (718) 486-7422.
